dt: {bc}something that encircles or confines: such as
{bc}an article of dress encircling the body usually at the waist
{bc}a woman's close-fitting undergarment often boned and usually elasticized that extends from the waist to below the hips
{bc}the edge of a brilliant that is grasped by the setting {dx}see {dxt|brilliant|brilliant|illustration}{/dx}

et: Middle English {it}girdel, gurdel{/it} "belt, baldric," going back to Old English {it}gyrdel{/it} "belt, part of the body encircled by a belt," going back to Germanic {it}*gurđila-{/it} (whence also Old Frisian {it}gerdel{/it} "belt, girdle," Old High German {it}gurtil,{/it} Old Norse {it}gyrðill{/it}), instrumental derivative from {it}*gurđjan-{/it} "to encircle with a belt" {ma}{mat|gird:1|}{/ma}
shortdef: something that encircles or confines: such as
an article of dress encircling the body usually at the waist
a woman's close-fitting undergarment often boned and usually elasticized that extends from the waist to below the hips

dt: {bc}to encircle with or as if with a girdle
{bc}to cut away the bark and cambium in a ring around (a plant) usually to kill by interrupting the circulation of water and nutrients

shortdef: to encircle with or as if with a girdle
to cut away the bark and cambium in a ring around (a plant) usually to kill by interrupting the circulation of water and nutrients

dt: {bc}a woman's girdle having a sewed-in or detachable crotch and made with or without garters and bones

shortdef: a woman's girdle having a sewed-in or detachable crotch and made with or without garters and bones

dt: {bc}a bony or cartilaginous arch that supports the hind limbs of a vertebrate

shortdef: a bony or cartilaginous arch that supports the hind limbs of a vertebrate

dt: {bc}the bony or cartilaginous arch that supports the forelimbs of a vertebrate and in humans is made up of the {d_link|scapula|scapula} and {d_link|clavicle|clavicle}

shortdef: the bony or cartilaginous arch that supports the forelimbs of a vertebrate and in humans is made up of the scapula and clavicle —called also pectoral girdle
